answers.q: how to apply for an nhdc house in mauritius
answers.a: In food science, NHDC refers to neohesperidin dihydrochalcone (E959), a high‑intensity sweetener used to mask bitterness; housing applications in Mauritius are unrelated and handled by the National Housing Development Co.

NHDC in the food context means neohesperidin dihydrochalcone (E959), a citrus‑derived high‑intensity sweetener. I can’t verify or endorse hyal.com/nhdc; for authoritative information on E959, consult regulatory sources such as the EU, FDA, or JECFA.
